moves.2. Qh5: set up the opening play for an early check
moves.4. Qf3: and one last stab at it
moves.4... Nf6: so now the game can begin in earnest
moves.5. d3: defends the bishop at c4 and frees up the c1 bishop as well
moves.7. Bg5: trapping his knight there and setting up a potential queen/rook fork in the next move
moves.7... Bg7: but he wisely defends the knight
moves.8. Nc3: making my knight active and freeing up a castling possibility
moves.8... Rf8: he further shores up the knight and presents the possibility of attacking my queen soon
moves.9. Qh3: so i attack the e6 pawn for a possible check
moves.10. Nge2: freeing up another castling route and bringing the other knight into play
moves.10... Qf7: getting the powerful queen and rook on one file, setting up a future attack on f2
moves.11. O-O: but that attack is defused of threat by the castling
moves.11... Nh5: he moves the knight out anyway, lots of possibilities for a move to f4
moves.12. d4: attacking e5, hoping to bring my e2 knight into play if he takes the pawn
moves.12... h6: which he doesn't, forcing me to address the attack on my bishop first
moves.13... Nc6: a triple move: he brings his knight into play, attacks the weak d4, and frees up the back row for castling
moves.14. d5: i decide to change plans and fork the knight and pawn
moves.15. exd5: and i complete the parry to put the knight back in danger
moves.15... Nb4: he flees and sets up an attack on c2
moves.16. Nb5: attack the knight and force him to make his attack now if he wants it, and set up my own future attack if he moves his queen off row 7
moves.17. Rac1: and i attack with the bishop
moves.17... Nd4: smart move, sets up a knight trade from either of my knights, and a king/rook fork check if i don't take it
moves.18. Rxc7: but i decide to ignore his knight's threat for now and force him to address his queen
moves.18... Nxe2+: which he delays by putting me in check and stealing a knight with no possibility of trade - i neglected that possibility, stupidly
moves.20. Nxd6+: but he made a big blunder and missed that great opening
moves.20... Kd8: he insures that he'll at least get a rook out of this deal
moves.22. Nxg7: and i decide to trade my knight for his second bishop
moves.23. Qxh6: and i grab a pawn and attack the knight, knowing i'll probably at least get another pawn out of this
moves.24. Qxg6: and i grab the other pawn
moves.25. d6+: but he missed another crucial opening, and his knight is doomed
moves.25... Kd7: he makes sure he'll at least grab my pawn and eliminate the promotion risk
moves.26. dxe7: but i grab his knight and take the threat off my queen
moves.27. Bb4+: and a check that should net me a bishop for rook trade if i want it
moves.30. Qd7+: and i make my huge blunder because my conditional moves got messed up -- i planned to take f8, then grab a8 when he fled from check, and the game would have been all but over here
moves.30... Kxd7: but instead he grabs my foolishly offered queen
moves.31. Bxf8: and i follow through on the long hovering bishop for rook trade
moves.32. f3: and i remove his threat to f2
moves.32... Kd6: he fortifies the weak pawn at e5
moves.33. Rd3: and i'm setting up several avenues for attack and movement
moves.34... Rc1+: he checks me anyway, to get me up to the second row
moves.35... Rc2+: so that he can put me in check again and start going after the second row pawns
moves.37. f4: time to free up the middle of the board b/c i'm planning an end run for promotion to redeem this disaster
moves.38. Kxf4: and i take his pawn back
moves.38... Kc5: he protects that now weak knight
moves.39. h4: and i start edging those pawns up
moves.40... Rxa2: he takes that other unprotected pawn
moves.41. h5: and i continue the drive for the end game
moves.41... Ra6: logically he doesn't want to make it too easy
moves.42. g5: and i shore up the eventual move to h6
moves.43. Rd7: and i move him out of the way while keeping his king locked off from my advancing pawns and potentially attacking b7
moves.43... Ng3+: he's got check and a fork on h5
moves.45. h6: so i move the now protected pawn up to row 6
moves.45... Nf2+: and he goes for check again, jockeying around in hopes i'll make a mistake
moves.47. Kg6: but that just allows me to move up with my pawns
moves.48. Kf7: and i move further up, anticipating having to protect the pawns some more
moves.48... Ng4: he's now prepared to sacrifice a knight to get both those pawns
moves.49. h7: but i won't oblige, leaving me a move away from taking back control
moves.49... Ne5+: he forks my king and rook
moves.50. Ke7: but even if he takes the rook he doesn't have much chance
moves.50... Ng6+: check again, and he attacks h8 to prevent promotion
moves.51. Kf7: and i give him back the same fork while attacking his knight
moves.52. Ke8: and i give him a different move so we can't keep this game up
moves.53. Re7: and i offer a trade that would still leave me with an impending promotion
moves.53... Rc6: he declines and sets up a rook to c8 mate
moves.54. Rxe5: but he apparently forgot about the unprotected knight
moves.54... Rc7: attacks the pawn, knowing that if i simply promote it, he can put me in check and eliminate the queen right away
moves.55. g6: so i just protect the pawn for now
moves.55... b5: he starts his own promotion drive
moves.56. Kd8: but i won't let him keep me locked up
moves.57. Kc8: and i attack again. no chance now, he's done
moves.57... Rg7: i guess he plans to at least get rid of one pawn
moves.58. h8=Q: but that's fine, i have a queen now
moves.58... Rxg6: he takes the pawn as planned
moves.60. Qe4+:
and there you go, forked check where he'd lose his last rook, and he resigns. 

hopefully that was interesting, i wanted to annotate a game with plenty of maneuvers, and in this case he fought hard and i had to come back from a collosal blunder to win anyway.
